title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
3 points

  • One point: investment falls because the cost of borrowing has increased

  • One point: the currency appreciates due to increased demand for currency in foreign exchange markets, inflow of foreign funds or increased supply of foreign currency

  • One point: decrease in exports due to appreciated currency the price of exported goods has increased for foreign purchasers who are importing the goods (purchasing power argument)
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point: investment falls because the cost of borrowing has increased

  • One point: the currency appreciates due to increased demand for currency in foreign exchange markets, inflow of foreign funds or increased supply of foreign currency

  • One point: decrease in exports due to appreciated currency the price of exported goods has increased for foreign purchasers who are importing the goods (purchasing power argument)

Earns 1 of 3 points.

  • One point: decrease in exports due to appreciated currency the price of exported goods has increased for foreign purchasers who are importing the goods (purchasing power argument)

  • One point: decrease in exports due to appreciated currency the price of exported goods has increased for foreign purchasers who are importing the goods (purchasing power argument)

Earns 3 of 3 points.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

On a Correctly Labeled GRAPH: AD falls --> output down and price level down
descriptions:
No point earned.

On a Correctly Labeled GRAPH: AD falls --> output down and price level down

Earns 1 of 1 point.

On a Correctly Labeled GRAPH: AD falls --> output down and price level down

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
3 points

  • (1 point) Example of expansionary fiscal policy: increase G or decrease T

  • (1 point) working through the aggregate demand or aggregate expenditure output up and price level up

  • (1 point) deficit financing: nominal interest rates increase so price of existing bonds falls, OR increase in the supply of bonds lowers the price of bonds

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

  • (1 point) Decrease administered interest rates (or provide an example such as a decrease in interest on reserves)
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • (1 point) Decrease administered interest rates (or provide an example such as a decrease in interest on reserves)
